content.description: Start on an edge just big enough for matching, get two feet, and go straight to the jug rail.
A fun route that includes a variety of holds from crimps to slots to slopers as you make your way up the left most wall of the big boulder.
content.location: Sit Start with both feet in the crack to the far left, left hand on the corner, right hand on a little crimp. Left heel hook over your left hand, left hand comes in to a sloper to the left of your right hand, then pull hard to bump the left hand further back to a pretty good hold, right hand goes out to the right-most slot, left foot comes into the pocket behind the heel hook, right foot comes down to the little divet way down low, left hand moves to the sloper above the crack jug, right hand moves to the top, match feet, right foot goes into the pocket above your left foot, heel hook around the corner below the crack jug, left hand goes to the top and turns to a mantle as you maneuver yourself over the top.

content.description:
Sit start on the rail edge on the far right side of the face and traverse left. Don't use the top until you hit a dish near the end of the boulder and can top out.

Beta Video
content.location: The face on the right side of the prow on the second smaller boulder.

content.description: SDS with the rightmost holds on the large undercling. Move up right to a thin crimp, bump to jugs, top out.
content.location: Just right of "Pop, Lock, and Drop It" on the left end of the main wall.

content.description: Start on the narrow right face in this dihedral. The left hand is a side-pull crimp on the obvious bulge against the left face. The right hand is a well-chalked, large edge around the arete. Pull on, and then stem up the dihedral to the top.
content.location: On the main boulder in the dihedral/arete system to the right of Send It Up.

content.description:
Sit start with opposing side pull crimps. Climb straight up using only holds on the face for hands and feet.

Beta Video
content.location: The obvious blank face in the center of the main boulder

content.description:
Sit down start with both hands on the undercling. Drop, Lock & Pop It straight up to the top. The arete to the left is technically off, but it will not help you anyway.

Beta Video
content.location: On the left end of the main face of the large Boulder.

climbs.name: Nobody Puts Wolfy in the Corner

content.description: Same start as STEM Student, except this time move straight up the arete. Traverse over to make the topout easier.
Sit start underneath the overhanging prow. Work up the prow and top out at the end.
content.location: The overhanging prow of the second smaller boulder

content.description: Start matched on the crack jug with Mr. Steal yo' proj, pick your feet, and jump straight for the jug about 4 feet above you. Small boulder, Big move!
content.protection: pads are tricky, could be rolling down the hill.  Get a few and a big spotter
content.location: right most boulder when looking up the hill.

content.description:
Stand start with your left hand on the arete. Traverse right across the entire bolder without using the top. As you approach the far right side of the boulder your hand and foot rails move closer together. Finish the problem when they converge and you can step straight of the boulder.

You can also do the Masters Traverse in Reverse aka the PHD Traverse. This is a variation that starts on the far right side and traverses all the way to the far left side.
content.location: Starts on the far left side of the face of the main boulder and traverses its entire length.

content.description: So this is kind of a sketchy climb because there is very little protection, but it is fairly easy. You start sitting on the rock sticking out to the right of the boulder (shown in the picture) and you have two starting holds (also shown in the picture). You basically just work your way up the face of the boulder and mantle over the overhang.
content.protection: So right behind this climb is a tree. You can't really get much protection here unless you have a thinner pad, but you would most likely hit it when climbing. Your best bet is to just have a spotter right behind you when climbing.
content.location: This route is on the second boulder between the main boulder and the third boulder. (So between the boulder that has the STEM Student route and the one that has the Micro Dynamico route).

content.description: Same start as STEM Student and Wolfy, but stay low moving around the arete and layback on the rail as far as you can before reaching for crimps at the top.

Start on good hands on the left side of face of the boulder. Span right to jug on the prow. Work your way around the boulder and top out on the other side.

Beta Video
content.protection: Easy to slide down hill. Spotter recommended.

content.description:
SDS with opposing side pull crimps. The right face of the dihedral is on for the start. Move up to the large vertical edge and high left arête then top out.

Beta Video
content.location: Same start as Send It Up, to the left of the large dihedral in the main face.
